title: Vitamin B12 (Methylcobalamin)
overview: Vitamin B12, specifically in its active form Methylcobalamin, is a dark red crystalline powder that plays a pivotal role in nerve health, DNA synthesis, and red blood cell formation. It is essential for neurological function and energy metabolism. Methylcobalamin is widely used in pharmaceutical and nutraceutical products for the treatment and prevention of Vitamin B12 deficiency, and is often preferred for its superior bioavailability over other forms.
features: Active and highly bioavailable form of Vitamin B12
Supports nerve health, cognitive function, and red blood cell production
Suitable for tablets, capsules, injections, and oral sprays
Excellent stability when stored under recommended conditions
Available in both Methylcobalamin and Cyanocobalamin forms

applications.title: Pharmaceutical
applications.description: Used in injectable, oral, and sublingual formulations for the treatment of megaloblastic anemia, neuropathies, and Vitamin B12 deficiency

applications.title: Nutraceutical/Food
applications.description: Incorporated into multivitamins, dietary supplements, and fortified foods to support nerve health, energy levels, and overall wellness
